results.description:
Do you want to learn how to take professional portraits? Do you want take home a studio quality portrait of you? In just two hours, you will learn tips on how to light faces and direct your models to pose in various assignment situations. 


This is a simple, no-nonsense but hands-on workshop where you get to shoot a series of professional-quality headshots for your own portfolio. Provided by exhibiting photographer Rebecca MB Pearson and NYU Photography Professor, John Hart.

Use any camera with a zoom capability of at least 85 mm. Although DSLRs are preferred, you can use a point-and-shoot camera. Beginners are welcome, however, we recommend that you have a thorough understanding of how your camera works, particularly manual settings for aperture and shutter priorities.

Syllabus

1.  Introduction to the course.

2.  Short presentation on portrait examples.  Discussing lighting, posing and directing situations. 

3.   Lighting set up.

4.  Live shooting.

5.  Critiquing.
results.name: How to Shoot a Studio Quality Portrait on a Budget

NodeSchool gives you a chance to work on interactive programming lessons with mentors available in case you get stuck or have any questions.  This event is recommended for engineers with JavaScript experience. We're supporting several different lesson plans to allow for all experience levels. No Node.js experience is required.

Bring: An ID to show security and your laptop 

Prepare: 

Install Node.js before arriving. We'll certainly be available to help get Node.js installed if you're having issues, but coming prepared will mean more time for coding!

Condé Nast is a premier media company renowned for producing the highest quality content for the world’s most influential audiences. Attracting 115 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital, and video brands, the company’s portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Details, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, and Style.com. Built While Flying is Condé Nast’s digital team who is dedicated to growing our already rapidly expanding digital consumer base.

A “prompt” is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

Every business always has a few choices in how it is going to make money. How do you know which one is the best for you?

In this Workshop we will review different types of business models and their pros and cons.

The following business models will be covered:

• Manufacturing / Creator 

• Merchant / Distributor 

• Data 

• Advertiser 

•  Brokerage

•  Commission 

•  Landlord


We will then discuss a framework you can use to figure out how to choose the right business model for you, how to think about complementary revenue streams as well as the pricing strategy.

We will finish by reviewing your business model and each of you will get my personal feedback.

Please send a payment of $25 via paypal to [masked] by November 4th. Same day or at the door price is $30.

--------------------------------------------------------

About Victoria Yampolsky, CFA:

Victoria Yampolsky, CFA, is the President of the Startup Station, a finance & strategy consultancy for startups and small/mid-size businesses. She is also an advisor to Mobilosophy, Divvy Tools, and Plan to Start, as well as founder of several ventures in media & entertainment. Previously, Victoria worked in Deutsche Bank Research and did IT consulting for CapGemini's Financial Services Division.

Social Painting Night: Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge (795 8th Ave, New York, NY - At 48th St.)
WHEN: Friday, November 6th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

Event Description


“Brand” Everyone talks about it, very few really understand what it means. Here’s a secret…your brand is not your logo, it’s not your color scheme, or even your beautifully designed website... Brand is something much much more…

Join us on November 5th at the Wix Lounge for a hosted panel of brand and branding experts as we discuss what “Brand” really is, and how to shape, build and even defend your unique brand identity. 

About the Venue

Thank you to our partner Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

group.name: Queens Chinese and English Language Exchange Meetup

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

And if you're coming right from work Vintage does serve food...very Reasonable and Good

Vintage has been serving the White Plains community for many years.

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*

results.description:
Jim Shaw: The End is Here


Join us for the first New York retrospective of Jim Shaw, one of the most influential artists of the last thirty years. 

".. moving between painting, sculpture, and drawing, and building connections between his own psyche and America’s larger political, social, and spiritual histories. Shaw mines his imagery from the cultural refuse of the twentieth century, using comic books, record covers, conspiracy magazines, and obscure religious iconography to produce a portrait of the nation’s subconscious. "

Floor 2: 7-7:30

Floor 3: 7:30-8

Floor 4: 8 - 8:30

We will meet up again at 8:45 at the entrance and find a place nearby to get food or drinks.

See you there!

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.

Payment can be made in class.

results.description: Hey there fellow thespians! Are you committed (like me), to getting hired as an actor? One of the essential tools we need to keep sharp is: great monologues. To keep our monologues fresh and kick-ass, I'm creating this meetup so we can practice with each other and be ready when opportunity knocks. Everyone will have a chance to perform at least one (two minute) monologue. Then, your peers (us) will give you feedback / suggested adjustments. Take 'em or leave 'em. Then you perform it again. Depending on turnout, we may each do this again with a second monologue. Unless someone has access to free professional space, I will rent space at one of the NY rehearsal studios - in which case, there'll be a small fee to cover the rental space (divide cost of space by number of attendees). So - location TBA. If successful, I'd very much like to do this regularly. So - who's in? Art Brown www.ArtBrownProductions.com
results.name: Practice Monologues

In a world without political freedom, personal freedom and precious little faith in anything comes a mysterious man in a white porcelain mask who fights political oppressors through terrorism and seemingly absurd acts. It's a gripping tale of the blurred lines between ideological good and evil.

or your local comic book store!

results.description:
Landlord Tenant Litigation Workshop with Mr. Michael Mantell, Real Estate Dispute and Landlord Tenant Attorney 

Door Fee: $25 | Early Bird Fee: $15.00 

Register: bzhive.com/nov5NYC

<a href="http://bzhive.com/LandTrustNYC"></a>

------------------------------- 

New York City landlord/tenant law grows more complex each year. With each new case and judicial opinion, it only becomes more important to get advised by an experienced attorney who knows the New York State court system precisely.

Presenter: Michael Mantell

Michael Mantell is a 1969 graduate of St. John's University School of Law. For over 40 years, his law practice has focused on civil litigation

Michael has helped clients to create effective solutions for their legal problems. He has represented thousands of clients and tried hundreds of cases including over 50 jury trials. He has argued numerous appeals including arguments to the Court of Appeals, the highest state court in New York. Several of his victories have made the cover of the New York Law Journal.

Michael successfully runs his own legal practice and specifically focuses on landlord and tenant law, partnership and business litigation and real estate disputes.

Join us for the WORKSHOP to learn or to ask questions about:

• Residential eviction/summary proceedings for possession

• Breach of lease

• Cancellation or renewal of lease or lease options

• Residential lease disputes

• Sublease disputes and rent control problems

• Eviction notices

• Non-primary residence litigation

• Landlord occupancy, etc.

Michael Mantell may also answer your questions regarding your rights as a Landlord or your rights as a Tenant.

Agenda:

6:30 PM EST– Registration

7:00 PM EST – Workshop begins

8:00 PM EST – Q&A session with the presenter

results.description:
Share, learn and network with fellow Product Managers at The Product Group.

Some topics to expect...
- Being Relevant 
- and more...

Featured Product: Rocketrip

From Kevin O'Neill, Product Person at Rocketrip:
"I’m the VP of Engineering and Product lead at a startup thats now been kicking around for a couple of years, Rocketrip (http://rocketrip.com).  Rocketrip provides companies a tool to help manage their overall spend on business travel by leveraging game mechanics to motivate employees to spend below dynamically set thresholds.  In short, we create budgets based off of real-time data, predict what the employee would have spent and then give the employee 40% of their savings (against our budget) in cash.  So if the employee saves $1,000, they pocket $400.  We’ve been hiring over the last year and are now poised to execute against our vision, which puts us in a really exciting position to build out our platform."


Note: Please make sure your meetup.com information is up-to-date (incl. First & Last names). You will need to show ID matching the name you used to RSVP. 


Hope to see you there!
results.name: The Product Group November 2015

results.description: Want to make a positive change in your life but not sure where to begin? After hearing all the hype about running, do you want to give it a shot? Are you dying to find out if a runner's high is the same as being high? You've made it to step 1 (joining the TMIRCE Meetup). Let's make it to step 2: run. Join us for a six week Beginner's Running Program starting Thursday, November 5th. Mileage will start around 2 miles at a 12+ minute per mile pace. We'll have two group leaders in case anyone wants to run a little slower or faster. Sorry all to all you experienced runners, but this is a running newbie only event. That being said, if you have any friends that you've been trying to convince to join you for a run with TMIRCE but they aren't feeling ready, this is a great place to get them started! Invite friends, enemies, coworkers, family members, or that cute guy that you always run into at the deli while you're buying ice cream on a Saturday night. Catch you on the pavement!
results.name: Beginner's Running Program 1 of 6

results.description:
We are pleased to be co-sponsoring a screening of Beyond Measure, a documentary film that sets out to challenge the assumptions of the way we educate children in the United States.


Click here to buy tickets in advance for $15. If available, tickets will be sold at the door for $20. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m4LTV8jat2o

More About the Film

Every day we hear stories about America’s troubled education system. And we’re told that in order to fix what’s broken, we need to narrow our curricula, standardize our classrooms, and find news ways to measure students and teachers. But what if these “fixes” are making our schools worse.In Beyond Measure, we set out to challenge the assumptions of our current education story.

Rather than ask why our students fail to measure up, this film asks us to reconsider the greater purpose of education. What if our education system valued personal growth over test scores? Put inquiry over mimicry? Encouraged passion over rankings? What if we decided that the higher aim of school was not the transmission of facts or formulas, but the transformation of every student? And what if this paradigm-shift was driven from the ground up? By students, parents, and educators? By all of us?

In Beyond Measure, we find a revolution brewing in public schools across the country. From rural Kentucky to New York City, schools that are breaking away from an outmoded, test-driven education are shaping a new vision for our classrooms. These are schools that see critical thinking, communication, exploration, experimentation, collaboration, and creativity as the key to good education. And they are dramatically improving outcomes for children of all backgrounds. They are schools where practically every student graduates and goes on to finish college.

Beyond Measure offers a positive picture of what’s possible in American education when communities decide they are ready for change. Are you?

results.name: Education Documentary Screening: Beyond Measure

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
On Dec.21st 2015, The Group That Shall Not Be Named will be 10 years old.

To celebrate this milestone we are starting a new multi-year project.

Starting with this Meetup, once a year we will provide scrap booking supplies and have each person at the event create one scrapbook page to put into a book that the org staff will assemble. The scrapbook pages should represent your own favorite moments, experiences, etc. with TGTSNBN during the past year.  These will be known as The Chronicles That Shall Not Be Named.


Each year will have its own volume, and we will have them out for special events, parties etc. And they will be photographed to create a digital version as well.

GUIDELINES AND DETAILS:

- This event has a $5 materials fee (plus 46 cent paypal fee). You can pay when you RSVP, or in cash at the Meetup (if you need to pay in cash at the Meetup MAKE SURE to mention this in your RSVP). If you can pay electronically, it makes the organizers lives WAY easier =)

- We will be providing a variety of 12x12 scrap book pages for each person from which to choose. Every attendee that evening will be allowed 1 page, with the possibility of a 2nd page, if we have additional supplies and space.

- If you are creating 2 pages, they need to be in a front to back style because of the scrapbook layout that we are using. Each person can only submit either 1 page or 1 front and back page to the scrap book.

- Please print out and bring your own photographs that you want to use. Photos should be either 3x5 or 4x6, we do not recommend photos larger than 4x6.

- Please bring your own scissors, if possible,  because we will have only 1-2 pairs to share.

- We will however have plenty of glue sticks, markers, crayons, and assorted scrap booking supplies. Also, feel free to bring any supplies of your own to use  and/or share.

This should be a fantastic event and we can't wait to see what you create!

UPDATE: We realized this Meetup might also be a good time for our members to make suggestions for events for next year. We will have a dry erase board up and will be jotting down your suggestions during the course of the night!

results.description:
DISCLAIMER by Renee Knight

A brilliantly conceived, deeply unsettling psychological thriller— already an international sensation—about a woman haunted by secrets, the consuming desire for revenge, and the terrible price we pay when we try to hide the truth.

Finding a mysterious novel at her bedside plunges documentary filmmaker Catherine Ravenscroft into a living nightmare. Though ostensibly fiction, The Perfect Stranger recreates in vivid, unmistakable detail the terrible day she became hostage to a dark secret, a secret that only one other person knew—and that person is dead.

Now that the past is catching up with her, Catherine’s world is falling apart. Her only hope is to confront what really happened on that awful day . . . even if the shocking truth might destroy her.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: Price per class is $25.00. New students first class is $12.00, either RSVP or just show up. Tell the receptionist you are here for Krav Maga and turn right to the Martial Arts room- can't miss us.

Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

A warm welcome if this is the first Scottish dance evening you have thought of attending. The group offers the chance to enjoy and learn Scottish dancing in a relaxed and social setting. From September until June we offer an opportunity to warm up and do a simple dance with everyone and then to learn steps, patterns, and dances in a beginner class for part of the evening.  After the beginner session there's time to have refreshments, socialize and make new friends, and then dance socially with everyone.

This session is our end of series party! If you have country dance experience there will be dances you'll be able to do! If you brand-new to country dancing, feel free to come and watch, but you may want to wait one week until a new series begins on November 12th!

results.description:
Very Important before attending. Please read this completely. We will be reading from Ascended Master written material for five Minutes or so and then practicing some simple Meditation Techniques of the Ascended Masters such as the I AM Decrees, Visualizations of the  Three Fold Heart flame and the Violet Consuming flame of forgiveness and more... There will also be Plenty of time for discussion and Questions and Answers. This Meditation Practice will be Guided with also some time for Silence practice. It will be for about 15-20 minutes. We will be having this Group every month. Practicing in a group is know to greatly enhance our Spiritual experience so please join us and see. We ask that everyone Practice Silence about their Personal Inner Spiritual Experiences at the meetup group and only speak in a very general and light way, like this worked for me or I felt Joy or love etc. without going into details and to Please Follow the Program Outlined by the Organizers. This will make for a more equality consciousness in the group with out people standing out as being more spiritually Conscious then others. It is not the purpose of this group to talk about our personal Spiritual experiences but to learn the teachings and techniques to have our own Spiritual experiences and Awakening, that is our focus.


Thanks and we Look forward to seeing you all then.


Peace & Blessings


Mindy & Anthony

results.description:
"Mixed Nuts" (by Justin Krebs, 11/5/15)

The off-year elections send off mixed messages:
from wins to regulate money in politics
to a loss for healthcare in Kentucky's gov race,
it's a foggy forecast for the year ahead.

The president's pursuing a mixed bag of policies:
banning the box and taking aim at criminal justice,
but putting boots on the ground in Syria,
and pursuing a deeply flawed TPP trade deal.

And then there's the mixed up GOP primary:
Carson rising on inane and insane comments,
Rubio rising as Jeb tries to "fix it,"
and Trump preparing for his SNL turn.

All told, it's a week of mixed politics,
but one thing that's totally clear:
The GOP field is a bunch of mixed nuts.

Come out for a drink and share what you think
with fellow like-minded left-leaners
at your local progressive social club.

Join us for our weekly gathering. As your busy week almost comes to an end, unwind with other similar-minded progressives over liberal libations.  

You can find us in the covered upper deck of the backyard -- look for a large banner on the wall, like the one shown above.  The NYC Chapter of Drinking Liberally has been gathering at Rudy's Bar & Grill since our in inception in 2003.
results.name: Weekly Thursday Meetup ("Mixed Nuts")

results.description:
The NYC Junto will meet on Thursday November 5, 2015 at the General Society Library, 20 West 44th Street. Please arrive at 7:45 to hear the featured speaker. This event is free and open to the public.

The featured speaker will be legendary investor Victor Niederhoffer. Niederhoffer's topic will be the principles of financial speculation.

Niederhoffer is a hedge fund manager. He studied statistics and economics at Harvard ('64) and received a PhD from the University of Chicago ('69). He was the best squash player in the world in 1975. His autobiography is The Education of a Speculator, published in 1998 by John Wiley & Sons.

Founded in 1985, the NYC Junto is a monthly meeting hosted by Victor Niederhoffer and moderated by Barron's columnist Gene Epstein.

Related Links

NYCJunto.org

facebook.com/events/[masked]


meetup.com/NYCJunto


twitter.com/NYCJunto

twitter.com/VicNiederhoffer

Podcast: https://itun.es/us/oQ4F0.c

<a href="http://dailyspeculations.com/"></a>

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
We are women who OM, and we want to tell you our stories.
(An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. And from that moment, everything changed. That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the world think is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world hotter, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of her journey into Orgasmic Meditation. For more information contact Marissa at[masked]
results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.description:
We are women who OM, and we want to tell you our stories. (An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. And from that moment, everything changed. That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the world think is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world hotter, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of her journey into Orgasmic Meditation. For more information contact Marissa at[masked]
results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
“Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord” (Ps 33:12, KJV)

Please join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Town Hall Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Don Watson, National Vice-Chairman and North Carolina State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Earl Grover, National Board Member and Director of the Christian Men in Leadership and Veterans of the Constitution Divisions will lead us in prayer and spiritual insight about how we as Christians can turn our country back to its Christians heritage.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

The conference call will last for about an hour and a half, but staying for the entire call is optional. If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: Christian Party Town Hall Conference Call

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

PMJAMNITES
----------------------
is an event held 1st Thursday of the month to attract & showcase local talent and create an artistically social event. Artists pre-sign up to perform and are delegated a slot to perform . Designated Artists are featured and showcased .

PMJAMNITES LIVE MUSIC begins at 9:00 pm thru 12:00 am

PLAYMUSICIAN

-----------------------
For more Info / news / pics / videos Visit :- Facebook.com/PMJAMNITES

PlayMusician provides a platform for artists, both upcoming and established, to showcase their talent, ranging from singer /songwriters , photographers, comediens, dancers, solo artists, spoken-word/poetry, full bands and more..

We promote local artists and musicians by creating musical events with eclectic themes and showcasing them. Seasoned artists are matched with up and coming artists.

We provide a comfortable, laid back venue with the intention of being a place where people can come together and enjoy local artists, and eventually becoming a staple in the community.

An artist’s passion is what we hope to support and encourage. It’s an artist community or family that we hope to grow through our events, website, social media and personal networking.

We help local businesses such as bars/restaurants become music venues .
Playmusician has been an artist bedrock since 2010.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
Back by popular demand!  David S. Kidder, a serial entrepreneur and best selling author, will discuss learnings from interviews with some of the most well known entrepreneurs, including Elon Musk, Reid Hoffman, Tony Hsieh, Sara Blakely.  All featured in his book, The Startup Playbook. 

David is the co-founder of Bionic, an enterprise innovation accelerator and platform. Prior to Bionic, Kidder served as the co-founder and CEO of Clickable, an online advertising software as a service (acquired by Syncapse). Prior to Clickable, Kidder co-founded SmartRay Network, a mobile advertising pioneer (acquired by LifeMinders), and Net-X, a web-authoring platform (acquired by Target Vision). Kidder is a graduate of the Rochester Institute of Technology, and received ID Magazine's International Design Award and Ernst and Young's Entrepreneur of the Year Award in 2008. David is an active angel investor through his fund, Alt Option Return with investments including: Art.sy, TapAd, MileWise (acquired by Yahoo), PayOff, HowAboutWe, BoostCTR, Maxwell Health, Content.ly, PopExpert, Lenndo, and Founders Fund III. David is a founding member of the The Acumen Fund One Percent Fund, and serves on the National Board of the Smithsonian. He is also the creator and co-author of the two-time New York Times bestselling five book series, The Intellectual Devotional, published by Rodale. He lives in Westchester County, New York, with his wife and three sons.

David will give a free copy of his book for the first 20 attendees!
results.name: The Startup Playbook - peek behind the scenes of some of the best entrepreneurs

results.description:
Time to try something new!  Stop working at home alone, or in a Panera.  Get out and find a place where you can do your work on your own, but be around like minded people!  This is where communities are made for entrepreneurs! If you are a writer, consultant, designer, or programmer -- This is ideal for you!

This is not a typical meetup. This meetup is to offer you a FREE morning to work out of The CoWorking Space and understand what coworking is all about.

We have coffee, water, snacks, free parking in the back lot (unlimited hours) and on Main Street (for only 3 hours).

We have great food right around the corner, banks, ATMs, convenience stores and more all within your reach. So get out of your house, stop working alone and come by for a FREE day!

Besides bringing your laptop, bring business cards as you will meet others to network with in between work.

See you on our next Fun Friday!

Noelle

results.name: Free Fun Friday

results.description:
Hello Friends! This week we are geeked to have Alex Dahmani come by and share!

Alex is the Founder and CEO of QuiO (/ kwee-oh /), a medical device startup leveraging smartphone technology to create the next generation of drug delivery device.  The Smart Injector is used by patients at home to automate the self-injection process, preventing common injection errors and giving chronic disease patients the ability to confidently treat themselves.  After each shot, the hand-held device wirelessly sends data confirming dosage and injection performance to an adherence monitoring platform, enabling loved ones and caregivers to remotely track medication consumption in real-time.


Alex studied Business and Genetics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, and subsequently entered a Ph.D. program in Microbiology & Immunology at Columbia University.  In his third year at Columbia, Alex decided to leave the Ph.D. program in order to launch QuiO.  He is currently focused on fundraising and business development. 

In addition to building QuiO, Alex is an InSITE Fellow, where he works with startups in New York to help refine their strategy and raise venture capital. 

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
A woman who embodies the greatest traditions of screen acting while fiercely embracing innovation and risk, Cate Blanchett inspires others to deliver their best work, challenges the field to be more fully engaged with women artists and audiences, and propels cinema forward with intelligence and grace. Her performances in three films from MoMA’s collection—collaborations with directors Peter Jackson (The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring), Martin Scorsese (The Aviator), and Steven Soderbergh (The Good German)—are featured, alongside some additional examples of her best known and most celebrated work.

Blue Jasmine

2013. USA. Written and directed by Woody Allen. With Cate Blanchett, Alec Baldwin, Peter Sarsgaard. Jasmine French is ubiquitous on the New York City social scene, until her husband Hal does some funny business with fund management. Once he wipes out their fortune—and the savings of hundreds of others who trusted his heretofore undisputed business acumen, a broke and broken Jasmine heads to San Francisco hoping her sister Ginger will take her in. Blanchett’s brittle, deluded Jasmine earned her a richly deserved Academy Award for Best Actress. 98 min.


Admission to MoMA and its film program are free on Fridays.
<a href="http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing"></a>
results.name: FREE MoMA FILM - Cate Blanchett: A Tribute

Afterwards, let's discuss how Joseph Campbell's ideas on metaphors and symbols relates to this talk at the American Wing Cafe.

You need to pay admission fees to enter the Uris Center for Education. The Museum accepts any amount you wish to pay for admission. However, the maintenance of the artifacts as well as the facilities of the museum costs about $40.00 per visitor, per day. Please be generous. We are lucky to have the Metropolitan Museum of Art in our city.
results.name: Pre-columbian Architectural Models as Metaphors of Place Landscape and Belonging

  Hello Cultured Families & Mini Movie Buffs! Here is a monthly event that joins together our "Cultured Kids go to..." & our "Mini-Movie Buffs" series! Let's go to MoMi!

The Museum of Moving Image in Astoria, Queens is the country's only museum dedicated to the art, history, technique, and technology of the moving image in all its forms. There are video games there, historical films being screened, artifacts from the famous movies and more!

I went to this museum a couple of months ago with my daughter, 7 and her friend and they had a blast. This place is great for kids 4 and up, and adults too! So please join us!

Admission:  Fridays from 4PM- 8PM is absolutely, 100% FREE!!!

RECOMMENDED AGE: 0-99 years old

EVENT TIME: 4 p.m.- 8 pm / until you have to go bye bye

results.description:
Slow Food Int'l VP Edward Mukiibi will be speaking at NYU Friday about African and North American grassroots strategies around food, land grabbing, traditional knowledge and biodiversity, and the hope for the future. He'll be joined in conversation with professors from the Food Studies program and the Public Policy School. 

It's short notice but I think we can learn a lot about how local/personal/national policies impact the planet.

Following the discussion, enjoy light food and wine from Ferrari Trentodoc & Tenute Lunelli. 

The event is FREE but you can register here:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1665888730289580/
results.name: Food Sovereignty and BioDiversity Talk

results.description:
¡Sí se puede! Yes, you can do it! 

Recuerda que no se trata de una CLASE. Lleva contigo una sonrisa y unas historias, pero prepárate  a aprender algo pues eso va a ocurrir de manera natural, te lo aseguro ...

Remember, this is not a CLASS! Bring a smile and some stories but get ready to learn a lot nonetheless and it's going to happen so naturally, I promise you... 

-RaFa

results.description:
The RSVPs on this site are a fraction of all the sites involved.

Our highly rated Social Mixer + Sound Bites session returns this fall. 

Learn how to disarm common Socialist talking points in three swift steps. No more lengthy FB back and forths, screaming matches and stalemates. 

Our panel of lawyers, statistician and expert debaters will rate your response and instruct you in the fine art of verbal Jujutsu. 

You'll get to practice your comeback before a convivial audience of friends and pro-Liberty allies. 

EVENING HIGHLIGHTS 
---------------------------- 
5.30 - 7.00 pm : Meet‘n’Greet. Social Mixer 
Bring your business cards. Make new friends and catch up with current ones in the comfort and privacy of our chartered room and  bar.  

7.00 - 8.00 pm: SoundBites - Practice Self Defense Moves against common Socialist talking points. You'll get to practice and improve your comebacks on our volunteers of ex-Liberals who will play their former selves. 

1. Choose one of three jury groups to help formulate a response 
to a talking point. The subject will be handed to your group when it's assembled. 

2. Elect one or two group spokesperson to take the stage with the opponent. 

3. Your group will have five minutes to disarm the talking point. Please be advised that our volunteers will be quite convincing in channeling their former inner Saul Alinsky. 

4.  Our panelist will rate your group's performance and advise you on areas of improvement.  

Participation in this fun segment is optional for those who prefer to just drink and observe from the side.   

8.00 pm - 8.30pm: Panelist & Audience feedback + Concluding Remarks 
Recap on your experience and what you like to share with the audience.  

8.30 - 9.30pm: Continue social mixer and merry making.  

Donation welcome to help cover the cost of the event.  
Food and drinks on your own tab. 

Houndstooth Lower Level - Mahogany Room
results.how_to_find_us: Jack Dempsey's Lower Level - Private Space.
results.name: SoundBites: Practice Verbal Martial Art against common Socialist talking points

results.description:
This is a nice very spacious bar, with decent drinks and food. It's located two short blocks away from the Broadway stop on the N &Q train line. 

From their site:

Break is LIC / Astoria’s most exciting entertainment venue. We are centrally located on Broadway between 32nd and 33rd streets just steps from trains and public transportation. Often referred to as an adult play-ground, Break offers numerous activities including Billiards, Ping-Pong, Darts, Vintage Arcades, Foosball, and Hoops!

With a 55 foot long bar that includes a rotating selection of 18 beers on tap, dozens in the bottle, as well as a full range of cocktail options, there is always something new to try. We also offer a full food menu with a great selection of American comfort food. With 16 true HD television displays, 2 giant projectors and state of the art audio and video capabilities, Break is also the area’s premier venue to watch all your favorite sports teams compete.

Whether you are out with a large group or on a first date, Break offers a perfect atmosphere that is unmatched in the area. 7000 square feet of exposed brick, massive industrial heating vents, and soaring 12-foot ceilings give the space a cool industrial feel that is sure to impress.

results.description:
Our monthly group meet-up is a great way to meet up the group, socialize, catch-up, pitch, get support for your projects and just to have fun.

Agenda:

Informal Networking: Getting to know each-other. Specially useful for the new-comers.

Round-table: Members share who they are, what they do, what are they planning or intending to do and what kind of help or collaboration they need.

Review & Plan: Reviewing the progress done in the last month and the plan for the coming month.

Open Forum: Any ideas, suggestions, feedback etc.

Social: Going somewhere in the neighborhood to eat, drink and more chit-chat.

Parking: There is ample parking at the back of the property or at the side road.

Some of the projects:

Feature length film "Kites Day". Script is ready and the project requires funding.

Members are welcomed to bring any friends, food and drinks in the meeting.

Contact #:[masked] for any other information or help in directions etc.

NYC's Largest & Most Diverse Afro-Caribbean Mixer For Diaspora Professionals
Come Early To Network | Stay Late To Party
Free Before 7:00pm with RSVP | $10.00 after 7:00pm

You must RSVP by EOD on Thursday November 5th @ www.AfropolitanNYC.com to be added to the guestlist

**Note: You must be checked in by 7:00pm for free admission. There is usually a line so plan to arrive, latest by 6:30pm to ensure you are checked in by 7:00pm.

Join us for an evening of connections and culture over cocktails @ NYC's largest Afro-Caribbean where diaspora professionals can connect, unwind and enjoy incredible fusion of Afro-Caribbean music by A-list superstar DJs.

Checkout the video and photos below for a taste of the Afropolitan
Afropolitan Video:

https://vimeo.com/134194864

Space is limited and we are anticipating a full house so please RSVP as soon as possible.

Join me and over 500 hundred other professionals, and get ready for a unique and exciting Afropolitan experience.

DJs: DJ EL-G | DJ Spynfo | DJ Birane
Music: Afrobeats | Dancehall Reggae | Soca | Hiphop | Pop | Latin

venue.name: Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

Hey guys!  Now that we are well into Fall and headed straight for Winter, it's time to gear up for some great new events. Please join us this Friday at Lexington's at The Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex for a fun and casual gathering where members of our staff will be on hand to welcome you, introduce you to others and let you know all the cool things we have coming up for the end of the year and 2016!  We would also love to hear your ideas! Stop by for a drink or stay the whole night! Free admission, drink specials and games & prizes.What to expect: 60-80 people coming together in a fun and friendly atmosphere to network, connect, socialize and find out what is going on in and around NYC with the various groups we work with.

Food and Drink Specials till 8pm

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.  Dave will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others.  You can also participate in the Grand Central Scavenger Hunt and After Work Party (All NEW CLUES) - 11/06/2015 which starts and ends at Lex that same night.

Dress code: Business casual

What time?  Doors open at 6pm.  The crowd will likely be there until around 10pm.  If you wish to join the scavenger hunt please arrive by 7pm.

Can I bring a friend or coworker? Yes!

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].
results.name: After Work Party:  Fall & Winter Events Preview

results.description:
Join us for our November German Culture meetup at Public House NYC to have some conversation, fun, and drinks! We will meet in the main bar area and have a couple of tables reserved.

There is a Happy Hour until 8pm:

$4 select domestic drafts

$5 house wine

$6 house drinks

Update: We just got confirmation that Public House extends Happy Hour until 8pm for us. Make sure to check in with the hostess upon arrival so you can receive a wristband for the extended happy hour specials. 

Is there a cover charge?


No, our monthly meetup is always free of charge. If you like, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank to help offset the cost to maintain the group. It is highly appreciated, but not mandatory or expected.

How to get there by subway?


It's on 41st St between 3rd Ave & Lexington Ave:

4/5/6/7/S(Times Square Shuttle): Grand Central - 2 Blocks

B/D/F/M: 42nd St Bryant Park - 5 Blocks

Please, as always, if your plans change, update your RSVP so we can give the venue an accurate number of attendees.

We hope to see many of you guys at the event, thank you everyone for coming, and don't hesitate to give us your feedback, we appreciate it!!

results.description:
A critical task in rebuilding a society ravaged by extended armed conflict is to develop mechanisms to establish a stable, just, and harmonious society. Essential characteristics of a transitional justice model are assurances of the general stability of the state, land and property restitution for victims, social inclusion for different cultures and psychological reparations for all. Education plays a crucial role in this process, and is the foundation of equality of opportunity, creativity, knowledge, exploration, and critical thinking. .

In this seminar, panelists from Colombian Academics chart the commitment of the Colombia, an early adopter of the One Laptop Per Child program, to education, and detail the steps taken and to be taken to protect human rights.
results.name: Post-Conflict Revival – Lessons from Colombia

group.name: Progress and Prosperity, Land and Liberty – New York City

Hackathons are coding competitions, where individuals and teams build mobile apps from scratch over a 24 hour period. The apps are then pitched to judges and prizes award for the best apps. Hackathons are a great opportunity to learn new technologies, network with fellow developers, enjoy some food, most importantly have some fun! 

 Bring your laptop, skills & ideas and join us for 24 hours of learning, coding and hacking! We’ll supply quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake.

venue.name: Center for Social Innovation New York City

results.description:
Dear WebRTC enthusiasts, you have a unique opportunity here to leverage your conceptual skills and start at this event ahead!


>> Registration here <<


Have an app idea or need an app built for your business?

Join us for a Mobile App Hackathon produced by the AT&T Developer Program and Alcatel-Lucent.  Hackathons are coding competitions, where individuals and teams build mobile apps from scratch over a 24 hour period.  The apps are then pitched to judges and prizes award for the best apps.   Hackathons are a great opportunity to learn new technologies, network with fellow developers, enjoy some food, most importantly have some fun!

The Hackathon will be held in New York City at the Center for Social Innovation, starting Friday, Nov 6 at 6pm and ending Saturday Nov 7 approximately 8:30pm.  See the full schedule below.

We Supply: Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. Along with technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools.

You Bring: Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person, designer, entrepreneur, student, or just interested in tech; you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

Event Schedule. 
The following is a list of the weekend's agenda:

Day 1

• 6PM - Kickoff event with dinner, networking, and developer dating which leads into idea pitches and team formation.

• 7PM - Speakers present (please see below for list)

• 8PM - Pitch ideas and form teams

• 9PM - Alacatel-Lucent Rapport™ Call Management Workshop


• 12AM - Facility will close for the night. Go home and get some sleep or find a hacker nest in order to continue coding.

Day 2

• 10AM - The fun continues with coffee served in the morning! Work with the teams from Day 1 to complete the app spec’d. Mentors will be available throughout the entire day to help you code up your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 4PM.

• 11:30AM - Lunch is Served

• 5PM - Dinner is Served

• 6PM - Pencils down. Pitches start promptly at 6PM and are limited to three (3) minutes per team. No powerpoints unless you are only presenting an idea.

Prizes. 
The following prizes are experiential and geared towards accelerating you towards a successful business as well as expanding your network and industry knowledge:

Best Overall App - $2,500

• Best Use of Alcatel-Lucent Rapport™ Call Management APIs (See below for more information)
1st Place - $2,500
2nd Place - $1,000
3rd Place - $500
Crush on Apps
Internet of Things - $500
Location Services - $500

• Best App Built on Azure - $500


Judging Criteria. 
Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.  

• 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does

• 33% Weight - Originality of idea

• 33% Weight - Technically creative and/or challenging implementation

  


Hackathon Legal. 
Hackathon Terms: http://db.tt/kyPS9ojR

Social Media. 
Follow us @attdeveloper for live updates and photos from the event
"Like" us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/ATTDeveloper

Rapport Call Management APIs

The Rapport call management APIs give your application a unique chance to take full control of subscribers’ calls (both signaling and media) and deliver value-added services for consumers and enterprises. Your application can perform audio and video play-back, collect digits from the user, request for call recording, create conference calls and control the participants, and simply enable or disable the subscriber’s Voice Over LTE features.

There are several reasons why the developers and companies who have used our APIs love our APIs:

They are implemented with a REST interface, easy to use in web developer’s languages like JavaScript, nodeJS, json, php, perl, etc. No need for you to know SIP and Telecom architecture, minimizing the time for developing the service,

• They make the mobile app available on any mobile OS and address the iOS restrictions,

• They do not require the mobile users to use another phone number,

• They are Telco-grade network APIs, which bypass several limitations of applications running over the top (OTT). As a developer, you don’t need to worry about complex services such as legal interception, voice call continuity, voice mail etc. All these services are inherited from using the APIs,

• Finally they enable developers to deliver new contextual communications based on personal information, enterprise information, IoT objects and big data! 

Speakers

Dan Kliebhan is an API Evangelist at Alcatel-Lucent. He’s a developer at heart and loves hacking at the job and as a hobby. He is based in Chicago, IL.


Gilles Duboue is Marketing Manager of Rapport APIs at Alcatel Lucent. With his firm understanding of the market needs, he leads developers towards the most valuable use cases and services leveraging Rapport APIs. He is based in France. 


Pawan Bhardwaj

 is a Sr. Product Manager at Alcatel-Lucent. He manages the Rapport API program and developer ecosystem. He is passionate about unlocking the innovation potential of telecom networks to create new applications and services that make everyday life – work, family, social interactions – better. He is based in Dallas, TX.

Ed Donahue, Sr. Product Marketing Manager at AT&T, is based out of sunny Seattle! She is passionate about enabling developers and hackers to create awesome stuff! She's a huge supporter of women in tech and encourages everyone to try programming.

Sponsors
results.name: AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - New York City

Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked]. 

Hey guys!  Now that we are well into Fall and headed straight for Winter, it's time to gear up for some great new events. Please join us this Friday at Lexington's at The Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex for a fun and casual gathering where members of our staff will be on hand to welcome you, introduce you to others and let you know all the cool things we have coming up for the end of the year and 2016!  We would also love to hear your ideas! Stop by for a drink or stay the whole night! Free admission, drink specials and games & prizes.What to expect: 60-80 people coming together in a fun and friendly atmosphere to network, connect, socialize and find out what is going on in and around NYC with the various groups we work with.

Food and Drink Specials till 8pm

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.  Dave will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others.  You can also participate in the Grand Central Scavenger Hunt and After Work Party (All NEW CLUES) - 11/06/2015 which starts and ends at Lex that same night.

Dress code: Business casual

What time?  Doors open at 6pm.  The crowd will likely be there until around 10pm.  If you wish to join the scavenger hunt please arrive by 7pm.

Can I bring a friend or coworker? Yes!

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk toward the back of the lobby, we'll be on the raised section on the left.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

We had so much fun at the first potluck on Oct. 9th that I'd like to make it a regular monthly event. 


Amazing food, amazing company & conversation, fun music and very chill vibe... it was a blast so let's do it again!

I'll be contributing my favorite salad (kale tossed with tahini sauce and soy chorizo), appetizer (tortilla scoops with Beyond Meat beefless crumbles and salsa), and a signature cocktail....what are you going to bring?  :) 


Also, I'd really love it if each vegan guest could do their best to bring a non-vegan to hang out...I think it's awesome for people who aren't vegan to get a taste of the amazing diversity and deliciousness of the food vegans have come to know and love, and party and meet fun people while doing it.  If you don't bring a guest, that's cool, but if you can, that would be a plus (one or two!  haha)! 


Can't wait to see everyone!
results.how_to_find_us: 2 or 3 to Bergen Street or Q to 7th Avenue
