results.description:
The Schomburg Center hosts a social networking event the first Friday evening of each month, rain or shine, from 6 pm to 10pm.


This month, the theme for First Friday @ the Schomburg will be the Michael Jackson vs. Prince, in tribute to the two musical icons who have paved the way for pop culture and have inspired people of all ages across the globe.

Enjoy signature drinks and extended viewing hours of their two current Exhibitions:

• Unveiling Visions: The Alchemy of the Black Imagination, and

• Black Suburbia: From Levittown to Ferguson

The host for the Night will be Dhalimu from Dhali's Closet, and Groove to beats by Kandy Inc. in the Langston Hughes Lobby.

Suggested donations are welcome and sign up for a Schomburg membership is always encouraged.


Our Meetup


We'll meet in the Langston Hughes lobby where the music will be playing. There will be a drink table with a HarlemGo Meetup sign to gather there.

Please find me (Daniel) at the HarlemGo drink table. I, as well as others, will be wearing a "GO" name tag (similar to the image above) on the front of my jacket/shirt, and name tags will be given out to identify other members. 

Many of the library and NYPL staff and executives attend the Schomburg Center's First Fridays events, as well as a wide variety of professionals from many backgrounds and industries. Definitely a good social & networking opportunity!

Post-First Fridays Drinks at Ginny's Supper Club

Afterwards, we'll head down to Ginny's Supper Club at Red Rooster
(www.ginnyssupperclub.com) to keep the good spirits going with a nightcap of drinks at the bar, socializing and dancing. Making a dinner reservation at Ginny's is strongly suggested for those that may want to grab a bite after the Schomburg event.

We'll arrive at Ginny's around 9:30pm and will end the meetup there officially at 11pm. If you can't make the Schomburg event, feel free to meetup with us there, and anyone is welcome to stay as long as they'd like.

Ginny's Supper Club is located on the downstairs level of Red Rooster
(www.redroosterharlem.com), 310 Lenox Avenue, between 125th & 126th Streets. 

As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center:

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue).
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

About The Schomburg Center

The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, a research unit of The New York Public Library, is generally recognized as one of the leading institutions of its kind in the world. For over 80 years the Center has collected, preserved, and provided access to materials documenting black life, and promoted the study and interpretation of the history and culture of people of African descent.
results.name: First Fridays @ The Schomburg Center & Ginny's (Red Rooster) After

venue.address_1: 445 West 59th Street, Room 2200 North Building (Enter on 59th Street, between Columbus and 10th Avenue)
venue.name: John Jay

results.description:
The Council Of Young African Leaders will host the 5th annual CUNY Young African Leadership Symposium (YALS) at John Jay College of Criminal Justice in Manhattan, New York. This year’s theme Transforming Africa Through Partnerships will focus on the importance of public and private partnerships, within the African community and abroad.


This year’s program will feature keynote addresses by Ms. MacDella Cooper, CEO of MacDella Cooper Foundation and Ms. Bisila Bokoko, Businesswoman, Entrepreneur, Speaker, and Philanthropist among other high profile speakers and panelists.

Similar to a Town Hall debate, the symposium is designed to  encourage speakers, panelists, and the audience to discuss the most pressing African issues and how they can be solved through partnerships. Discussion will feature: African Diaspora’s Assimilation vs Acculturation Social Enterprise; Funding an African-Driven Development Ebola Lesson Learned from a Deadly Epidemic ICT and African Development How to successfully implement PPPs in Africa and the Role of the Youth and Women

Program: Friday, November 6th- 6PM-9PM Saturday, November 7th- 8am-5PM All meals served during the event. CUNY students are free, Other students: $25, Professionals: $30 - $50.  For registration and program, visit: http://www.yals.info
results.name: Transforming Africa Through Partnerships (CUNY)

results.description:
As the November chill approaches, come join us at this cozy wine bar in Greenwich Village, NYC. It's a perfect setting for getting to know new people and catching up with colleagues in the field. Amelie wine bar has great wines, small plates, dinner and dessert for whatever your mood may be!

This is a small event, but no worries. Sign up for the wait list and if you are bumped in, we will let you know immediately.

Also, there is a reservation for 6:30, so I'd like to meet at 6:15. This way, we will all be there and there is no chance of losing the reservation!

See you soon,

Meghan and the Organizing Team

*PS Small donations will be welcomed for upkeep of our website. We appreciate your support!
results.name: Escape the Autumn Chill at Amelie Wine Bar, NYC!

results.description:
The Amateur Astronomers Association is proud to present an astronomy lecture series from October through May each year for our members and the public. Everyone is welcome to attend. Admission to the lecture is free, and no reservations or tickets are required.

The lectures are held at the Kaufmann Theater of the American Museum of Natural History, on Central Park West between 77th and 81st streets. Please use the 77th Street entrance. Lectures begin at 6:15 p.m. and run to 8:00 p.m. 

More information at:

http://www.aaa.org/lectures/

Friday, November 6, 2015


Stella Offner
University of Massachusetts

“Our Lonely Sun: Exploring Why Many Stars are Born with Siblings”
results.name: Amateur Astronomers Association of NY Lecture Series at AMNH

results.description:
Social Painting Night: Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

* This is not an Asian only event.

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html


WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge (795 8th Ave, New York, NY - At 48th St.) 

WHEN: Friday, November 6th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM 

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
results.name: Social Painting Night: Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

We will be there every Friday night :)

"Tell me where he is…?" "He's everywhere! Eon Productions + Sony Pictures have debuted the full-length trailer for Sam Mendes' Spectre, the 24th James Bond movie, starring Daniel Craig as Agent 007. Thevery first teaser was a nice glimpse at the new Bond adventure, but this time we really dive into the story and all of the characters he encounters along the way. I'm loving the way this looks, with sleek cinematography by Hoyte Van Hoytema. Damn this looks stunning!

Please join us for an evening of networking and drinks at the Gastro Bar at 35th Street.  

We will discuss the workshops hosted this past summer, at our pop-up storefront: Civic Art Lab. Our lab was developed in collaboration with Bridge Street Development Corporation, sponsored by Build It Green and Material for the Arts. We will also discuss our plans for 2016. 

Our environmental, arts, and educational initiative calls on neighbors to co-produce creative ways to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental 


initiatives happening locally. The goal is to amplify diverse voices and encourage future community engagement.

Questions? Email [masked].

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge (795 8th Ave, New York, NY - At 48th St.)
WHEN: Friday, November 6th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge (795 8th Ave, New York, NY - At 48th St.)
WHEN: Friday, November 6th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge (795 8th Ave, New York, NY - At 48th St.)
WHEN: Friday, November 6th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM 

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). results.description:
Dear friends,

We are very proud to invite you to our second ART APERITIVO. Join us for an evening of art , wine and pizza! Given the demand from Italian artists to provide space and arrangements for exhibitions we at NEW YORK ITALIANS decided to offer some help.

Every two weeks we will provide upcoming international artists an opportunity to showcase their artwork in the heart of Williamsburg!

Let's support Art and artists!!

JOIN US FOR A NIGHT OF ART, FRIENDS, LAUGHS AND PIZZA! Our second Special Guest will be Skate Artist
Cory Scroggins: "KOOKY SK8 ART SHOW"


WHEN:

Friday, November 6, 2015 @ 6:30PM

WHERE:

Sottocasa Pizzeria - Williamsburg
232 North 12th Street
11211 Brooklyn, NY

NEW YORK ITALIANS SPECIAL:
$4 Moretti!!
$10 Pizza margherita!!

Come meet and mingle with New York Italians , Italians and Italophiles, Italian companies and professionals, new and existing members.

Stop by, enjoy a drink and great networking ...Italian style!

-Meet friendly people and make new connections,
-Practice your La Dolce Vita.

RSVP at [masked]
www.newyorkitalians.org See you there, ciao!
results.name: New York Italians Aperitivo!

results.description:
8 Meetup Groups Join Forces with

Professional and Business Social Network (PBSN) 

 to cordially invite You and Your Meetup Friends to the

The Manor - Dôme Nightclub

Dance Party & Social

Friday, November 6

***

 $20 admission at the door

* 

...OR...  

    $15 admission at the door before 8:15pm ($20 after 8:15pm) with this PRINTED email including information requested  ( PLEASE PRINT ) ...  CJ

*

First and Last Name ___________________________
*

e-mail address __________________________________
* 

Zip code __________   Cell Phone # __________________

No Printer - No Problem ... show us this announcement on your smart phone
with a completed Event Registration slip. 

No Smart Phone - No Problem ... email [masked] with subject "The Manor" and provide requested information. 

* 

 ...OR...  

purchase $13 tickets thru Eventbrite<------ Click here for details      

 *

( All admission fees include attending optional Instruction, Meet & Greet and Dance )

      Please forward this announcement to your friends!

*

The Place to be seen!


Over 175 attended our Last Dance!

Essex County

Enjoy the beauty of Fall

Merengue Dance Instruction  6:30pm Registration (optional)

Meet 'n Greet  7:15pm

Friday Dance Party & Social  8:00pm to Midnight 

The Manor - Dôme Nightclub

click venue name above for directions

111 Prospect Avenue, West Orange, NJ 07052 
( bordered by Eagle Rock Reservation to the east )

*

Merengue Dance Instruction

by Leslie

Registration 6:30pm -- Instruction 7:00pm to 8:00pm  

Meet 30 dancers at the instruction, a great icebreaker as you rotate partiners! Mix with 120 more new faces at the Dance and Social.

No partner needed. Tonight's class is for Beginner and Intermediate level dancers.  Accomplished dancers are always welcome to polish their skills and to meet new faces

*

Meet 'n Greet  7:15pm
Come Mix and Mingle; our Party Hostess will introduce you to new friends.


*

Friday Dance Party & Social   8:00pm to Midnight.

 "Mix, Mingle and Dance" in The Dôme Nightclub. PBSN's DJ will be spinning the hottest dance tracks of yesterday and today all night long! Come meet new dancers! Singles and Couples; all are welcome, expected median age 55. Introduce your friends to PBSN tonight in an elegant and sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere.

*

Come choose your food pleasure from the all new Late Night menu available to 10pm. Premium wines available by the glass ... Cash bar.


*

Dress to Impress:
The Manor requests business casual attire, jackets are preferred. 
No jeans, no sneakers, no shorts, no t-shirts.

 *

Guests, Friends, and Walk-ins are always welcome.
Membership is not required.

*

The Dôme, originally designed for but never integrated into the White House during the Benjamin Harrison administration [masked]), was adapted for The Manor and added to the West Orange landmark in 1975. 

Experience the grandeur of the Spiral Stairway and newly completed Two Story foyer on your way up to the Dome Nightclub.

  *

  QUESTIONS: Call Ralph  [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Meet 25 or more new friends during dance instruction... the ice breaker of all ice breakers! Then meet 125 new friends at the dance.

results.description:
Friday Night Futsal

Please wear futsal/indoor shoes or regular flat bottom sneakers.


$10 for one hour or $15 for two hours per player!!

NOT ALLOWED:

-Slide Tackles

-Unnecessary Contact

-Unnecessary Trash Talk


We are here to enjoy the game not to argue or fight!


Once you RSVP please show up!!


Please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have :)

**By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit to participate in this game. You voluntarily release NYC Futbol from any and all liability resulting from your participation and/or receipt of instruction.

results.description:
Three teams rotating since indoor is a fast game. We will play 5 v 5. Every 7 minutes or 3 goals we switch out, no team can play more than twice in a row.

Please wear a white shirt. We will have a red team, a green team, and a white team.

Bring EXACT changee: $10

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Join us as we watch and discuss Part 3: Prediction of the 3 part documentary series: The Code from a Rosicrucian Perspective.

View Website Here!

Watch Trailer Here!

Summary:

Marcus du Sautoy continues his exploration of the hidden numerical code that underpins all nature. This time it's the strange world of what happens next. Professor du Sautoy's odyssey starts with the lunar eclipse - once thought supernatural, now routinely predicted through the power of the code. But more intriguing is what the code can say about our future.

Along the path to enlightenment, Marcus overturns the lemming's suicidal reputation, avoids being crushed to death, reveals how to catch a serial killer and discovers that the answer to life the universe and everything isn't 42 after all - it's 1.15.

All Are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mystical Movie: The Code - Prediction

results.description:
Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

Location:

Chelsea Studios

151 West 26th Street 6th Floor New York, NY 10001

Ask for Chelsea Studios!

If you arrive before 6:30pm, please wait downstairs. An organizer will be waiting with a sign and will bring you to the classroom when we are ready. If you arrive after 6:45pm, check in with the guard, and remember to bring a form of ID. Go to the 6th floor and look for us there!

Don't forget to bring a notebook!

Here are some pictures from our latest session!

Thank you!

Japan Cultural Appreciation Group・日本文化友会

Contact / お問い合わせ先: [masked]

Website / ウェブサイト:

http://www.jcagny.org


Follow us on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/groups/317147851698725/

results.description:
Join us for a night of music and fine Italian dining at Saverio's (Formerly Spiaggia) in Long Beach!


This is a celebration of Matt's move down to Long Beach! The food here is amazing! The staff is second to none! Acoustically Correct will be playing their unique blend of 60s & 70s pop and rock hits by artists like:


The Beatles, The Monkees, Donovan, Buffalo Springfield, Simon & Garfunkel, Crosby Stills and Nash, Tommy James and the Shondells, The Kinks, Badfinger, Roy Orbison, James Taylor, Rolling Stones, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Van Morrison, The Eagles, Traveling Wilburys, Bob Dylan...MUCH MORE!!! We will start out on the quiet side during the dinner hours and then bring it up a notch (or three) as the night goes on!


I will be happy to reserve a table if there is interest in dinner or feel free to make your own reservations.


Check out Saverio's  at:


http://www.saverioslb.com/


Check out Acoustically Correct at:


http://www.acousticallycorrectmusic.com
results.name: Music and Dining With Acoustically Correct At Saverio's in Long Beach

All are welcome to join me as we sit in circle to connect with Spirit!

Please arrive promptly and dress comfortably.

Feel free to bring a beverage of choice - I usually have water.

If this is your first circle we will:

• Learn how to raise our vibration for the best connection;

• Learn all the ways Spirit uses our senses to let us know they are near;

• Share in the energy of like-minded individuals;

• Send distance healing to all whose names we offer.

This monthly meetup is free - However, the suggested donation is $5 - $10. None are refused!  I look forward to seeing you there!!! xoxo

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 30-42 - 2M/1F SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

Freedom Zone Internet Cafe is an internet cafe equipped with PC's that have LoL pre-loaded. The rate is $2/hr.

The price is NOT MANDATORY. It is a suggested donation to go toward covering the meetup fee ($144/year). Any donations will be greatly appreciated and allow you a custom title of your choice!

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 30-42 - 2M/1F SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Body Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

The Place:

Cosme is a restaurant in New York City’s Flatiron District serving contemporary Mexican-inspired cuisine. World-renowned Chef Enrique Olvera and his team create dishes rooted in Mexican flavors and traditions, while also celebrating local and seasonal ingredients from the Hudson Valley and surrounding region. Cosme’s beverage program focuses on artisanal spirits and mirrors its cuisine, letting the high quality ingredients shine

Menu is here:

http://www.cosmenyc.com/menu/menu.pdf

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

results.description:
Eric Andersen in Concert at the City Museum With Special Guests The Chapin Sisters

Tickets: Use the discount code FOLKY for $25 tickets (regularly $35) 


Eric Andersen, the finest singer/songwriter of romantic songs to come out of the Greenwich Village folk scene of the 1960s, distinguished himself with chestnuts such as “Violets of Dawn” and “Come to My Bedside” and the civil rights song “Thirsty Boots.” Rolling Stone called Eric, “the most elegant of singers,” while Bob Dylan observed, “Eric is a great ballad singer and writer.”


An award-winning and prolific songwriter, Andersen has released 30 albums. Artists from all over the world have recorded his songs, including Judy Collins, Peter, Paul & Mary, and Johnny Cash. Special guests with Eric are The Chapin Sisters. Carrying on the legacy of their famous father and uncle, the sisters have released five albums of songs with gorgeous harmonies, including the nationally acclaimed A Date with the Everly Brothers.

Tickets: Use the discount code FOLKY for $25 tickets (regularly $35)
results.name: In Concert, Eric Andersen

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.

results.description:
Hey everyone and hope you all had an awesome Halloween!

Figured it'd be great to catch up with one another and share some of our festive experiences or just what's been going on in the past few weeks over some all-you-can-eat Japanese food (and don't worry, the food's pretty damn sick for a buffet). 

For those who are new and arriving, don't shy away - we're all friends here and we'd all be ecstatic to meet you! Plus, what's better than bonding with new people over some awesome sushi?!

IchiUmi's got a variety of selections ranging from the quick and cool sashimi/sushi (toro, hamachi, etc.), to the more casual noodle soups (ramen, soba, udon, etc.) to more hotter and rich in flavor dishes(fried soft shelled crab, chicken teriyaki, etc.)

Of course there's also a dessert bar with the usual cookies, fruits, pastries and some ice cream: red bean and green tea.

So if any of this sounds anywhere near appealing, toss us an RSVP and we hope to see you there!

Event Location:

IchiUmi (Yelp)

6 E 32nd St
New York, NY 10016

b/t 5th Ave & Madison Ave 
Midtown East

Expect to bring about $50~ CASH preferred (tax and tips included). 


P.S. - I know the price point seems pretty high and discouraging but if you're really into some of the more "expensive" Japanese dishes that are served there (ie. toro, fried soft shelled crabs, raw oysters/clams, hamachi, etc) - then you'll easily eat your money's worth and then some!

For those who aren't as financially-strapped but aren't sure if the selections are right for you, I'll make sure to have our group be able to check what's being served first before we get waited to a table. 

P.P.S. - If anyone's still available after all that food gorging, figured it'd be pretty neat to just take a stroll through the city for awhile and enjoy the cool and fresh air as we walk off some of those cals and get to learn a little more about everyone in the group
results.name: [Midtown East] Ichi Umi: All-You-Can-Eat Japanese Buffet

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay College Friday 7:30 – 9:00 pm, Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center  members only). For full information on the team, please go to www.tnya.org. 

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues.


We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf


Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.

results.description:
Living on One Dollar (2012)

Two economics students studying international development in college try living on $1 a day for two months in rural Guatemala.  Approximately 1.2 billion people are now living on $1.00 or less each day.  How do they do it?  Answer: with difficulty.

They battle intense hunger, parasites and discover that there are no easy answers.  But they find inspiration in the lives of their neighbors Rosa, a 20 year old woman, and Chino, a 12 year old boy.

The film won Best Documentary at the Sonoma International Film Festival, the Directorial Debut Award from Washington West Film Festival, and received endorsements from Nobel Laureate Muhammad Yunus, USAID Administrator Rajiv Shah, and the Director of the Hunger Games, Gary Ross.

There will be a discussion afterwards. 

A $10 donation is suggested.

Child care is available
results.name: First Friday Film Series - Documentaries that mean something

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
What makes Ricardo different from other steakhouses is that from the time the doors open to the minute they close, it’s SHOWTIME. Guests are comfortably seated while captivated by the energy of our open kitchen. They watch their chefs create masterpieces right before their eyes and while waiting for their food, they can sing along to their favorite tunes mixed by their very own DJs.

At Ricardo Steak House, the trendiness of Downtown blends the rich culture of East Harlem by the art deco architecture of the restaurant. Patrons are treated to the sight of exposed brick walls adorned with local artwork and candle-lit tables, which give even the most casual meeting an intimate feel. We have created a very versatile environment that is full of energy and has a little something for everyone.

We already have a table reserved for 8 People. You will be refunded $5 if you rsvp and follow through with your attendance for this meet up.

DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event at 8pm.

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Friday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced


Please RSVP only if you are 100% sure you can make it.  When you RSVP, you are holding a spot for a meetup that has high demand.  No refunds will be issued if you decide to cancel.  

Only players on the ACTIVE list will be allowed to play (No Exceptions).  If you must cancel, allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list. 


RULES:

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay if it doesn't interfere with play)

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON Brooklyn

www.tennis-buffs.com

 

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.

 


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

 

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.

 

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

results.description:
On the last Friday of the month, our party moves to La Nacional, 239 West 14th Street (@8th Ave).  The rest of the time, we are at Stepping Out Studios. To get buzzed in to Stepping Out, dial 9 and the green call button on the key pad to the right of the building entrance.

Make sure to check our Facebook page (BluesDanceNewYork/events) to double-check our location!

*************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson

8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson

9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance


*************************************************************

Before you come in, it’s a great idea to take a look at this Etiquette Document that our community has compiled: http://bluesdancenewyork.com/etiquette

*************************************************************

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12. But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night!

If you volunteer, your admission to the dance is free for the night. Email [masked] if you want to be added to the list.

Bring dance shoes with slippery soles (for easy turning), or socks, especially when wet outside.

All ages. No bar, but it is BYOB. Water is provided.

There is no dress code, but hygiene is important and dressing up a bit is a nice thing to do. Prioritize comfort and ability to move!

**If you are taking the lesson, please plan to arrive on time. After 15 minutes have passed, students are no longer allowed to enter class.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

A NYC tradition since 1994, The MOONLIGHT RIDE is a casual monthly bike ride on PEDESTRIAN WALKWAYS. UNDER BRIDGES, AROUND PONDS, UP HILLS, and WINDING IN/OUT OF MAIN BIKE LOOP in Central Park! 

We've already done this ride twice before, and it is a truly magical and super-fun night!

We'll meet near the giant Globe sculpture in front of Trump Tower at 9:45pm, on the NW corner of 59th St/CPW, then join the larger group that does the ride every month.


As all our other rides, we ask for a $5.00 donation for HOUSING WORKS. (payable in cash or via Venmo: joeyisraelg1@gmail )

Join us for our Quiet Clubbing Party at the outdoor Studio Square Beer Garden! Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night…Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun too.

DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop, etc
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

See you there!

results.description:
Is salsa dancing and learning on your bucket list? If so, then you should come to La Fama, a Salsa dancing party that takes place every Friday in Times Square. Come out, bring your friends, and leave your worries and stress at home. With admission, you can take our complimentary FREE salsa dancing class and dance all night long to great salsa tracks played by our DJ. Here are the details:

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Discount: One time discount->If this is your first time attending and you RSVP this event, you get in for $5.

Time: The event starts at 10pm  and ends at 2am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 10pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris unless there is an invited instructor. Here is silvio In action:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMy3EtfWqSY

So come out, take your first class and enjoy putting those steps into practice with great authentic salsa music and great people. Then you'll finally be able to go to the clubs and lounges and not just watch and stay on the sidelines, but actually dance and express yourself. Let's do it!!
results.name: Salsa Dancing in Times square with Free Salsa Class

group.name: LA FAMA - Active Salsa Dancing Group - Free Classes

results.description:
Join the Time's Up environmental grassroots organization for a moonlight ride through Central Park. This is a fun, relaxing auto-free ride suitable for beginners. Enjoy the tranquillity of the park & its beautiful ponds & waterways: a nature lover's dream. Totally safe. Bike guides front & rear.

Meeting Place: Columbus Circle (SW corner of Central Park)
Date: 11/6/2015, Friday
Time: 10:00 pm

Pace: beginner

The ride moves at a very leisurely pace with a few stops to enjoy the scenery. We usually finish before midnight, back at Columbus Circle. Total mileage is under 10 miles. We do not require lights (although if you have them you should bring them), and any kind of bike will work.

For more information: http://times-up.org/rides/moonlight-ride-central-park
results.name: Last Minute Moonlight Ride in Central Park!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday -@west 134th Street Field - 7:45am

results.description:
https://www.eventbrite.com/buttoncreate?text=Sign%20Up%20Now&size=small&color=%23ffffff&background=%23f96e26&logo=full

https://whistlestop-2015.eventbrite.com


Join us for an approximate 20-mile walk from Cranford to Somerville, New Jersey, on Saturday, Nov. 7, 2015. We will start at the N.J. Transit Station in Cranford and finish at the N.J. Transit Station in Somerville (Somerset County). This walk through central New Jersey will closely parallel the "Raritan Valley" Line, which has weekend service from Penn Station in Newark. Walk the entire distance or return to Penn Station from any of the train stations along the way- Westfield, Fanwood, Plainfield, Dunellen, Bound Brook or Bridgewater. Eastbound trains depart hourly from most of these stations to Newark's Penn Station on weekends. For additional information and schedules, visit www.njtransit.com

Although most of the miles we walk will be on level, paved suburban streets and sidewalks, we will walk through a few parks along the way. There will be plenty of food and drink options along the route, but everyone should bring at least one bottle of water and a few snacks or energy bars. Comfortable walking shoes, sneakers or light hiking shoes are recommended. Click here for directions and travel advice to and from this event. http://api.ning.com/files/ZahK2JNbKSukG3SIv5m5xwCMdksR9Maa8Nm4NaQJb9VAPIL5fHeOErmZBt7R7UquEwwyOCbZJ2fK64NUAbvEHWi9ogzb2Rwi/WhistleStopTurnbyTurn.pdf

We will meet at 8:00 a.m. at the Cranford Train Station and begin our walk at 8:15 a.m. Led by Bob Quinlan.
results.name: Raritan Valley "Whistle Stop" Walk

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

Twitter: https://twitter.com/#secaucusaol

Length: 16 miles

Elevation gain: 6000 ft


Difficulty: strenuous

Meeting point:  The main parking lot at Breakneck,   ~ 1/4 north of the tunnel :

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Breakneck+Ridge+Parking/@41.4446669,-73.9807845,771m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m7!1m4!3m3!1s0x89dd331a43579b4f:0x5416717295f588b!2sBreakneck+Ridge+Trail,+Cold+Spring,+NY+10516!3b1!3m1!1s0x89dd331e8d9a6fe9:0xd593cb8e38e817fa!6m1!1e1

Trail:


We will start going up breakneck, following the white trail to Beacon fire tower,


then down to the reservoir, around it to the access road, climb up Lamb Hill, then to the Fishkill Ridge loop , then join the yellow trail which takes us over Sugar Loaf back to the parking lot.  We are not going down on Breakneck.

There is a  train from GC, arriving at Cold Spring  at  8:07  AM.   If you need a ride from the station,  drop a comment bellow, someone can usually offer a ride.

This is a strenuous hike, with a lot of ups and downs, scrambling etc.  It is recommended for experienced hikers only.  Please bring your own map and headlamp. Hiking poles highly recommended.

++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Hello Fellow DIY'ers,

I am so excited to be posting our next event in partnership with Habitat for Humanity. This event will be educational, inspirational and of course fun. I am looking for 4 additional women who are up for the challenge. Are you willing to learn construction at it's best?

Imagine either driving, or just walking passed a beautiful home you helped build for someone who is less fortunate. What if the new home-owner was outside watering his or her lawn, or just waiting with his or her child for the school bus? Would you go and talk to them? I would. See how they are doing in their home. This event will inspire you, take you to levels you've never been before.

Through the Critical Home Repair Program (CHR) we will help with necessary repairs on homes affected by Superstorm Sandy. CHR ensures the safety and the security of properties. For example, we may replace hardwood flooring, as well as perform interior renovation and including tiling, painting, installation and gypsum wallboard replacement work.

Volunteer activities include:

-Painting interiors

-Home construction and rehabilitation

-Rebuilding homes following natural disasters

-Bringing together communities by building neighborhood spaces

I know that the response will be overwhelming, so I decided to take all responses and qualify them, and then place them in a lottery. You will be notified of being selected.

Following the established Habitat model they rely heavily on volunteers and donated materials to help keep the costs low while serving as many homeowners as possible. No experience is necessary, but work boots are required. All volunteers must be 18 years of age or older.

Please contact Lisa at[masked] if you will be late.

Location @2834 Brighton 4th Street, Brighton Beach, NY

What they want you to know

Know Before You Go

You must be at least 18 years of age to participate on a construction site. And must be a GGDIY Member @ GirlsGoneDIY.com.


What to Bring & What to Leave At Home

Leave your unessential valuables at home. Unfortunately, we can’t guarantee a safe place to store them.
Water is available throughout the day. Please bring a reusable bottle to refill as you go.
Bring your lunch! (especially if you don't drive, most homes are in the suburbs)
They provide clean Port-o-Johns and hand sanitizer.


What to Wear

Wear comfortable work clothes since you will definitely get dirty!

Most of the homes we are currently building or repairing are not yet heated, however, warming stations are located throughout each home and provide minimal heat. Please dress accordingly - multiple layers are best.

For construction projects wear thick-soled shoes or work boots to comply with city & state laws. For safety reasons, you may be unable to volunteer if you don’t have the proper shoes.

Bring a bandana or skull cap to wear underneath the hard hat.

Habitat NYC provides gloves, tools, and safety equipment, although you are welcome to bring your own tools and safety equipment if you prefer.

Stay Safe

No smoking is allowed on site.

Site Supervisors and AmeriCorps Site Leaders are amazing and dedicated professionals who are responsible for your safety and can give you the best advice about how to build in the Habitat Way!

Cell phones and other electronic equipment may only be used in designated areas. Trust us, hammering and texting don’t mix.

If you cannot make it or even if you can, you may donate towards this experience by clicking the link below. Your donations are very much appreciated and will assist in getting this project rolling.

http://www.kintera.org/faf/donorReg/donorPledge.asp?ievent=1115862&supId=426723088&extSiteType=1

You're so fly, when you DIY!

Best Wishes,

Lisa
