We'll be playing funk this season. Join us for a great time playing in this group. We got the funk of Stevie Wonder, James Brown, Chic, Kool&The Gang, George Clinton and more! 

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (All charts will be posted by end of August) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

September 09/05, 09/12, 09/19, 09/26
October 10/03, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31 (halloween, boo)
November 11/07, 11/14, 11/21 (skipping Thanksgiving, Happy Thanksgiving!)
December 12/05, 12/12

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (13 sessions at discount + show fee) for $340  (you save $20)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


SONGLIST is (roughly, a song could be added or removed in a few weeks). Songs will be added over the weeks til November.

SUPERSTITION by Stevie Wonder (POSTED)

I FEEL GOOD by James Brown (POSTED)

JUNGLE BOOGIE by Kool and the Gang

GET DOWN ON IT by Kool and the Gang

SEX MACHINE by James Brown

GOOD TIMES by Chic

WE GOT THE FUNK by George Clinton&Parliament

PICK UP THE PIECES by Average White Band


Show Day is Sunday, December 13th at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in October) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

This show is going to rock!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge
results.name: Let's Play Funk!

results.description:
I can board game any time of year but there is something to be said for gaming when it's cold outside.  Particularly fall weather!  A few drinks with good people doesn't hurt either.

Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a giant suitcase full of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks!


                           Four people build a miniature city in Medina

What are we going to play?  I will have at least one new one on tap: "The Hare and Tortise."  Truth is, it's a kids game.  But it looks like a really fun racing game for a group of people.  Each animal in the race (more than just the two from the title) has a special way of moving.  You get secretly assigned one and play cards to move that animal.  First one across the finish line wins!  

Otherwise it'll be the usual fare of games like Medina,  Nuns on the Run, Avalon, Steam Park, Coup...  We'll play relatively simple modern board games that have a quick rules explanation and play in less than an hour.  

What, no Monopoly or Pictionary?  Strategy board and card games have changed, grown and evolved so much over the past decade that they have become wonderful art forms in their own right.  They tell stories and provide new situations for engaging each other in ways that party games or old classics can't.  These modern games wouldn't exist if games like Clue and Taboo hadn't paved the way.  But give the next-gen games a shot and you'll see why I'm so much more excited about new games!


If you're really curious about what I might bring, probe the nerdy depths of my collection and visit my Board Game Geek page.  The bar does have a nice copy of Catan on hand as well.

                   Build your own amusement park in Steam Park

I'm barely getting out of bed when this is starting!  I know that noon on a Saturday is a bit early for people--I get it, believe me--but as long as you show up by 4 (or even 5) you should be able to get some gaming in.

Skylark is a great bar in Park Slope in its own right.  But they are so board game friendly I just had to move our little meetup there.  They have some good bar food but are also open to bringing food as long as we clean up.

Negotiate for the best stock price with up to 11 people in Panic on Wall Street

My phone number is listed near the top of this posting if you have any questions day-of.  And with that we'll see you there!  Or else...

                           Point guns at each other in Ca$h 'n Gun$
results.how_to_find_us: At the tables in the back.  516 314-0228
results.name: Gameday--The Return of Board Game Weather!

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
HAMILTON HALL, ROOM 503

It's ironic that we live in one of the wealthiest countries in the world, but we always have money problems. We can work hard all our lives but retire poor.


Nobody teaches us how to manage our money in school. Financial issues are not often discussed, and financial products not always explained.

We all want comfortable retirement, but few have a plan. We may be active spenders but passive savers.

We need to change and the task won't be easy. But we need understanding first.

Join us for this life changing presentation. Some concepts to be covered include...

-Building a Financial Foundation

-The Wealth Formula

-The X-Curve

-The Importance of Paying Yourself First

-Simple VS Compunding Interest

& more...

My great friends & I will present a powerful message about how good it feels to own your future instead of fearing it, and what you can do to start taking ownership of yours.

I look forward to meeting all who attend!
results.how_to_find_us: Hamilton Hall, Room 503
results.name: How MoneyWorks & Building Your Financial Future

venue.name: New York Botanical Garden, Enid Haupt Conservatory

results.description:
** UPDATED 10/25/15 **

We will meet inside the Botanical Garden, in front of the Haupt Conservatory.  DO NOT USE THE MEETUP MAP!! USE GOOGLE MAPS INSTEAD!!

Photos from Central Park 2013

Meetup Point relocated to the Haupt Conservatory within the garden. The image below is from our first visit in Spring 2010.

Map of the Garden with the Haupt Conservatory indicated in red.

Website: http://www.nybg.org/

Usually we visit the New York Botanical Garden in the springtime. This year, let's capture some autumn foliage.

Weather permitting, we will meet inside the Botanical Garden, in front of the Haupt Conservatory.  DO NOT USE THE MEETUP MAP!! USE GOOGLE MAPS INSTEAD!!  General admission is $20. Check the website for other pricing. Make sure you ask for a map when you pay.

How to get there by Subway: 

• Take the B, D, or 4 train to Bedford Park Blvd. Station. From the station exit:


• Take the Bx26 bus east to the Garden's Mosholu Gate entrance.


• OR walk eight blocks down the hill on Bedford Park Blvd. (approximately 20 minutes). Turn left onto Southern Blvd. and walk one block to Mosholu Gate entrance.

For directions via Metro North, driving, and parking information, please visit the garden's website.

*****

We may split up into smaller groups.  The botanical garden is huge, so some of you may get lost and/or fall behind.  If you do, don't worry.  Just enjoy the garden and take lots of photos.  We may figure out a secondary meetup point to re-group within the garden.  

*****

From the website regarding Photography:

Plan to Be Outdoors

Most of the Garden consists of outdoor spaces, although there are indoor spaces open year-round as well. The Garden's 250 acres are open in all weather conditions, and a visit can include extensive walking. Please plan your attire accordingly.

Travel Light

The Garden does not have coat-check facilities and certain items are prohibited in various indoor spaces, so plan accordingly.

Photography

Outdoor photography for personal use is allowed, but you must stay on the paths and not disturb the plants and collections. In the Conservatory, photography is permitted with hand-held cameras only. During some exhibitions, photography may be restricted or limited to alleviate crowding and protect the plants. Photography is not permitted in the Art Gallery.

*****


* Be on time! This event starts at 12pm sharp!! So give yourself plenty of time to travel. Check for service changes or delays. I will not wait for latecomers and I will not answer calls, emails and/or messages after 12pm.

* Dress appropriately for the weather and definitely wear comfortable shoes.

* Food and restrooms are located inside the Garden.  Check the map.

Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.


If you have any questions, text me, message me (via meetup) or post on this page before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your text messages so I know who you are. 


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927) 

******************** 

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can either send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked], or you can contribute in cash at an event.  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet inside the Botanical Garden, in front of the Haupt Conservatory.  DO NOT USE THE MEETUP MAP!! USE GOOGLE MAPS INSTEAD!!

results.description:
Reiki is a wonderful spiritual tool to add to your tool box ! Reiki is a natural system of healing and creating balance in the body, mind and spirit. In this class you will learn how to DO Reiki. Your palm chakras will be opened to allow the clear flow of Reiki - universal life force energy. Reiki can be used to EMPOWER your life and shift the environment around you ! Reiki can be done on children, pets and plants as well as adults. Reiki can also help you to SHIFT deep rooted issues.

This class is open to everyone as everyone is capable of learning Reiki.

If you need additional information, you can email me at : [masked] or call / text : (516)[masked]

Investment  $150 (includes manual & materials, Reiki treatment and on-going support)

Time: 12 PM to 5 PM

Space: Limited. Please call or email to register

Results in certificate recognized by other practitioners 

If you are unsure if you should invest : close your eyes and ask yourself ' Is this something I am called to do right now' and listen for the answer. It will come.

"when the student is ready, the teacher appears"

results.description:
Come and watch some funny short films during the Big Apple Film Festival Short Film Program, including:

Jackie Boy

In a world morally bankrupt by social media, Jackie Boy doesn't belong. He lurks in the shadows of the streets seeking vengeance on the selfie generation. He is in love with Angie, who isn't like the others--an "angel" he calls her. And when the current superstar of social media beats Jackie for her hand, the ultimate confrontation ensues. Then we learn the truth about our hero.

Mother of the Week

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b4iGhH-5MlI

STACEY (Jennifer Jiles), a 41-year-old career woman has it all together - with the invaluable help of her children's perfect (inside and out) nanny, MARISA (Lexi Zettle), whom the three kids love, and Stacey's husband TIM (Mark Lobene) doesn't mind looking at either. When Marisa takes a week vacation, Stacey is happy to prove herself and reassert her own role as Mom and sexy wife. Easier said than done - Stacey finds that without Marisa's help, taking care of family and work is a little more than she can handle.


Prego

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dLXwKdzSa6Q

Prego is an award-winning short comedy film by Usher Morgan that tells the story of Emily (Katie Vincent), a young woman confronting a one-night stand (Taso Mikroulis) with the revelation that she's pregnant. Things go from bad to worse when Emily discovers that Mark is not an ideal father figure.


Hungry


Kevin is still in love with his ex-girlfriend, Caitlin. When he finds out she is dating a new, rich guy named Jeff, Kevin is heartbroken and wants to win her back. His best friend, Mark, warns Kevin about her, but Kevin is blinded by his love for Caitlin. Kevin believes he has found his answer when he finds a flyer to a burrito eating competition where the winner will win $1,000.

Reefer Man

Lenny Pringle, 65, returns from a two-week visit to his sister in Colorado, greeting his lifelong friend Curly Frye with a hug as he comes to visit. Lenny reveals his plan for 'jumpstarting' his new life: smoking the marijuana he has smuggled back from Colorado. Initially appalled, Curly finally agrees to Lenny's plan, and promises to visit a Head Shop in the morning to purchase items for smoking the weed. The next day, before entering the shop, Lenny reveals that he has made a list of items he wants to buy. Curly is surprised at the extent of the list.... and of Lenny's knowledge! They enter the shop and are greeted by a man named Dusty, who initially thinks they are undercover policemen. Lenny begins to get comfortable with Dusty, but Curly thinks he should not reveal too much about his plan. Curly leaves after Lenny tells him to 'lighten up'. Dusty (his friends call him Zombie), is impressed with Lenny's list, but tantalizes him with talk of showing him some 'new stuff'. They agree that Zombie will bring everything to Lenny's house later that evening. Zombie arrives, and instead of bringing the paraphernalia, he robs them at gunpoint, ties them up and gags them. They manage to remove the gags and call Curly's sister Diane. Diane arrives with her 'friend' Jennifer and they begin to cut the two loose. Lenny is smitten with Jennifer, who helps get a party started after releasing Lenny. After a raucous impromptu party, Lenny and Jennifer become friendlier, and she asks him if he is 'real disappointed ' about losing the drugs. He states that he is not, and that he has devised a new plan: A road trip to Vegas. Jennifer wants to go, but the other are reluctant. They are soon convinced that they should go too. Lenny proclaims that this is where his new life will begin, and they all toast to their big adventure.

Acoustic Space

'Acoustic Space' is a short film about how technology has changed the way we communicate. What Marshall McLuhan once described as a 'global village,' has become a society, if not a world, of people erroneously believing technology is bringing them closer together when in fact it is driving them further and further apart. The film addresses this issue in a funny and satiric way by showing a couple having dinner in an elegant restaurant while all attempts at conversation are constantly interrupted by their ringing cell phones.

HOW TO BUY? Tickets are available online: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/program-26-tickets-18713951934

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Hi Folks, based on our Doodle survey we've set a date and time for our first meetup! Please note that although the Doodle was for noon the meetup will be at 1PM as we've been warned that any earlier will be difficult due to weekend brunch rush. That's Saturday, November 7 at 1PM. Mark your calendars! I'll send out another reminder closer to the date because, if you're anything like me, it's impossible to remember anything planned that far in advance. 

Anyone who has Rheumatoid Arthritis or wants to support a loved one with the disease is welcome to join us. Feel free to spread the word to anyone you know who would benefit from our group. Just give us a heads up if you're bringing additional folks so we know how many people to fit in at our table. 

Looking forward to meeting all of you!

SCAVENGER HUNT AT THE MUSEUM


Saturday, November 7, 2015
1:00 PM

American Museum of Natural History
Central Park West at 79th Street, New York, NY (edit map)

NY - The Murder at the Museum of Natural History Scavenger Hunt

All tickets include admission to the museum. There are no special ticket types or discounts for museum members. Early Bird pricing applies to purchases made by noon on the Wednesday before the hunt.
The hunt is played on teams of two to six people. Someone, or something, has been bumping off museum staffers involved in acquiring a sacred Egyptian relic. Is it the dreaded Curse of Ahtchu? Or is a serial killer on the loose? Your team of sleuths will have to crack a hieroglyphic code and uncover the museum's secrets to stop the killings. For murder hunts, we strongly recommend hunting with a team of three or more. If you sign up with fewer than three people, we suggest pairing up with others at the start of the hunt to form a larger team. Early bird adult $42 https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10024209

results.description:
*Check out CNY's first Kickstarter Campaign!

----

“The greatest deception [people] suffer is from their own opinions.”


                                                        --Leonardo da Vinci

People often talk about how others are self-deluded, not “correctly” seeing “reality,” misinterpreting information and facts.  But what if we’re all self-deluded and we just don’t know it?  (Or maybe we’re self-deluded about how well we can assess our self-delusions!)


Well, for one night, we will deliberate, discuss, debate, and challenge each other to consider these and other related considerations about self-delusion. 

In particular, we will explore the ways in we (unknowingly) deceive ourselves, some cognitive and emotional reasons why we do this, and possible ways we can counteract these tendencies. 

Some of the questions we will consider include, but are not limited to:

·  Why do people believe weird things?

·  How can our prior knowledge both help and hinder our perceptions and interpretations of new experiences? 

·  How is it possible that the same cognitive processes—such as drawing inferences and making conclusions, synthesizing information from various sources, and analyzing and evaluating information—lead us to both “accurate” and “reliable” knowledge and also misunderstandings and misconceptions? 

·  Is it possible to know when and how we are deceiving ourselves? Is it even possible for us to see ourselves more clearly?

 ·  What counteractive strategies might help us to see ourselves, others, and the world around us more accurately and reliably?

Structure of the Discussion:

We will start by defining and establishing what self-delusion means and what examples of it could be.  (It would be great if you could bring some real-life examples of people who you think have deluded themselves, or, even better, personal examples!)

We will then discuss why and how people delude themselves.

We will consider whether and how we can counteract these cognitive tendencies.

We will reflect on the implications and applications of our discussion for our lives and the lives of those around us. 

We will make conscientious efforts and an official commitment to delude ourselves less and less everyday! 

About the Moderator:

Rolando is an educator of educators.  He works with teachers from the four major disciplines—Math, Science, English, and History—to craft, hone, and assess their pedagogical practices.  He has hosted other discussion groups on Meetup.  In his spare time, he enjoys reading, writing, and ruminating on how often he engages in self-deception. . . .


VENUE:  Bread and Butter, (Corner of E. 29 St and Park South)
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of E. 29 St and Park South.  Meet us at the 2nd floor Mezzanine.  Stairwell, back right of the deli.
results.name: "How Do We Deceive Ourselves? Is It Possible to See Ourselves More Clearly?"

results.description:
Extra Life in New York City! There will be TONS of games to play (Halo 5! Minecraft! Rock Band 4! And more!) TONS of awesome raffle prizes, giveaways, and mini-tournament prizes!

Extra Life (www.extra-life.org) is a gaming marathon that supports Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals (www.cmnhospitals.org). Since 2008, Extra Life has raised more than $14 million to help children's hospitals provide critical treatments and healthcare services, pediatric medical equipment, research, and charitable care.

New York City's local CMN hospital is Cohen Children's Medical Center (ccmc.northshorelij.com). 100% of all funds raised by Extra Life participants in the NYC area go towards local sick and injured kids who are treated there, regardless of their ability to pay.

Gallery Hop - Saturday, November 7, 2015 - 1PM!

We’re doing another of our ever popular Gallery Hops, this one in the well established west side photo gallery district of Chelsea with PWCC and our own Rita Russo. We’ll be revisiting and walking through the area to see what’s happening and combine our hopping (from gallery to gallery) with some actual shooting in the neighborhood.  We’ll meet in front of the Dallas BBQ Restaurant on the North West corner of Eighth Avenue and 23rd Street (the C and E trains stop right on the corner and the #1 train is just a block away). Let’s meet at 1 PM so we can start shooting and hopping with plenty of daylight.   A list of galleries and approximate times of our visit will be distributed and published here as well.  Bring your camera if you would like to do some shooting along the way or after.  The nearby Highline has been extended to 34th Street and the new #7 Westside Javits Ctr station has opened.  

RSVP at right.  Be sure to dress for the weather!

We'll meet up at the end and grab a bite to eat here: Pepe Giallo Restaurant,    [masked]th Ave (about 26th St), <a>[masked]</a>, PepeRossoto.com.


There is no charge for this event except your Dutch meal or beverage.

results.description:
Workshop Topic Details:

Hands-On Exploit Development

Want to write memory corruption vulnerabilities but don’t know where to start? Do you secretly aspire to Pwn2Own glory and a life as a freelance bug hunter? So many tutorials assume a certain amount of previous knowledge, or the example programs are so hard to find and setup so you can follow along.

This workshop tackles the basics of how memory corruption vulnerabilities work as well as helping you get familiar with the tools of the trade such as Immunity Debugger, WinDBG, and Mona.py. Using real vulnerable programs in a contained lab environment, this hands-on class will get you up to speed on the basics in preparation for further study in this exciting realm.

Instructor Bio:

We're excited to have Georgia Weidman as our guest instructor. Shevirah founder and CEO Georgia Weidman is a serial entrepreneur, penetration tester, security researcher, speaker, trainer, and author. She holds a MS in computer science as well as holding CISSP, CEH, and OSCP certifications. Her work in the field of smartphone exploitation has been featured internationally in print and on television. She has provided training at conferences such as Blackhat USA, Brucon, and Security Zone. Georgia founded Bulb Security LLC, a security consulting firm specializing in security assessments/penetration testing, security training, and research/development. She was awarded a DARPA Cyber Fast Track grant to continue her work in mobile device security culminating in the release of the open source project the Smartphone Pentest Framework (SPF).

She founded Shevirah Inc. to create product solutions for assessing and managing the risk of mobile devices in the enterprise and testing the effectiveness of enterprise mobility management solutions and is a graduate of the Mach37 cybersecurity accelerator. She is the author of Penetration Testing: A Hands-On Introduction to Hacking from No Starch Press. She was the recipient of the 2015 Women’s Society of CyberJutsu Pentest Ninja award.

For Every Workshop:

This is a hands-on workshop where you will put into practice those things you may have read about or covered in a class. This is also a great opportunity to meet other like-minded women and to keep your skills fresh if you're a veteran! You will also earn continuing education credits towards your certification renewal.

Every workshop progresses from beginner through advanced topic material. Beginners are encouraged to watch and learn as much as possible even though you might not have a clue. Exposure to new tools and techniques by watching will advance your learning process a lot more quickly than trying to learn on your own. You will get to ask questions and see how it's done in the real world. Advanced attendees are encouraged to share their knowledge and experience and help answer "noob" questions as much as possible.

Agenda:

1200 - 100: Set-up, introductions, and lunch (included)

100 - 600:  Training

(Please note that this will be active workshop time - if you have not completed set-up it will be challenging to follow along.)

Prerequisites:

Basic IT knowledge.

A good attitude and willingness to learn.

Remote and Male Associate Member Participation:

Register online. Once registered, you'll receive the meeting participation info by email the day before the workshop. Expect to join 15-30 minutes prior to test your technical configurations.

Prep Requirements:

Laptop with tools installed. Details will be posted soon.

Cost:

Full/Student/Military Member:  $35

Associate Member and Remote Attendee: $15

CTA Member:  FREE with code

Free (non-paying) Member: $50

YOU MUST REGISTER ON THE WEBSITE HERE

Thank you to our venue sponsor: Launch Workplaces

FOR THOSE WHO WILL BE IN NYC - The get together at iMentor scheduled for Nov. 7th has been cancelled.

If you have any questions please contact Pamela Dean at: [masked]

https://womenscyberjutsu.org/resource/resmgr/Images/launchworkplaces.PNG

results.description:
Join the NYC Celiac Meetup Group at the first Gluten-Free Oktoberfest in New York City! 

You are cordially invited to the first annual Gluten-Free Oktoberfest, the first gluten-free event of its kind on the East Coast. GF Oktoberfest was created so that people with gluten intolerance or celiac disease could safely come together and mingle while enjoying a selection of over 45 gluten-free ciders and beers and an unlimited amount of gluten free food. To add to the fun, meet some of the cider makers and brand ambassadors! Feast on a full gluten-free Oktoberfest menu with traditionally mouthwatering sausages, pretzels, meatballs, pizza, desserts, and much more. There will be vegetarian options too!

BUY YOUR TICKETS NOW

Choose from one of two sessions: 

Saturday, November 7 
Session 1: 1:00pm-4:00pm

Saturday, November 7th 
Session 2: 5:15pm-8:15pm

We want to make sure that as many people as possible can come to this event without cramming the joint too much. So, we’re having two time slots! The two time slots will have the same foods/beers/ciders, so, just find the time that works best for you! In order to ensure that everyone gets a chance to enjoy the event, only one time slot per person. 

21 and over only! Valid ID required. 

BUY YOUR TICKETS NOW

There will be NO tickets available at the door!

• Early bird tickets: $45 per person including tax, plus processing fee 
(Still available!)

• Regular tickets: $55 per person including tax, plus processing fee


Don’t delay, buy your tickets today. Tell your friends. Celebrate Oktoberfest! 


Disclaimer: GFOktoberfest is being held at Pie by the Pound, a restaurant that serves both gluten-free and non-gluten-free food. They take ever precaution to reduce the risk of cross-contamination. This event is STRICTLY gluten-free, with NO regular food for sale for its duration. 


Don’t delay, buy your tickets today. Tell your friends. Celebrate Oktoberfest!
results.how_to_find_us: Buy your tickets today: http://bit.ly/GFOktoberfestMeetup

We fence foil predominantly, but if you fence epee or saber, let me know and I'll bring mine.  It also helps if you leave a comment if you're going to the meetup and you'd like to fence epee or saber.


We will be charging $15 per meeting to cover the cost of renting the studio.  There is a significant discount for purchasing the entire semester which includes 14 2 hour classes.


We will do our best to provide instruction appropriate for each individuals skill level. 

We have some equipment to lend, but if you would like to borrow, please contact me at least 24 hours before the meetup, and let me know if you are left handed.


The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://maps.google.com/maps?q=380+broadway&hl=en&ll=40.718209,-74.002908&spn=0.006034,0.012703&sll=40.718109,-74.002904&layer=c&cbp=13,90.98,,1,-3.47&cbll=40.718122,-74.00297... ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

Beginners are welcome. Experienced fencers welcome. Everybody's welcome!

- Mike

·  Why do people believe weird things?

·  How can our prior knowledge both help and hinder our perceptions and interpretations of new experiences? 

·  How is it possible that the same cognitive processes—such as drawing inferences and making conclusions, synthesizing information from various sources, and analyzing and evaluating information—lead us to both “accurate” and “reliable” knowledge and also misunderstandings and misconceptions? 

·  Is it possible to know when and how we are deceiving ourselves? Is it even possible for us to see ourselves more clearly?

 ·  What counteractive strategies might help us to see ourselves, others, and the world around us more accurately and reliably?

Structure of the Discussion:

We will start by defining and establishing what self-delusion means and what examples of it could be.  (It would be great if you could bring some real-life examples of people who you think have deluded themselves, or, even better, personal examples!)

We will then discuss why and how people delude themselves.

We will consider whether and how we can counteract these cognitive tendencies.

We will reflect on the implications and applications of our discussion for our lives and the lives of those around us. 

We will make conscientious efforts and an official commitment to delude ourselves less and less everyday! 

About the Moderator:

Rolando is an educator of educators.  He works with teachers from the four major disciplines—Math, Science, English, and History—to craft, hone, and assess their pedagogical practices.  He has hosted other discussion groups on Meetup.  In his spare time, he enjoys reading, writing, and ruminating on how often he engages in self-deception. . . .


VENUE:  Bread and Butter, (Corner of E. 29 St and Park South)
results.name: "How Do We Deceive Ourselves? Is It Possible to See Ourselves More Clearly?"

Here's an awesome complimentary class on Saturday, November 7th (in less than 2 weeks) that we highly recommend!   Make sure to put it on your calendar. 


A LIVE FREE Online Event– 6 NEW Brain & Mindset Experts–LATEST Cutting Edge & Evidence Based Methodologies, Tools & Technologies to re-train your brain and "Shatter Your Financial Glass Ceiling". 

This year’s Live Brain-A-Thon will be hosted by brain expert and star of the Secret, John Assaraf, and he will be joined by 6 other experts in the field of neuroscience, neuropsychology and neuroplasticity. 

Here are the experts and a summary of the topics they’ll cover:

 - Dr. Daniel Amen - Change Your Brain, Change Your Income 
- Sharon Pearson- From Suicide to $10 Million a Year 
- Dr. David Kruger - How to Change your Money Story 
- Dr.Heidi Hanna- Eliminate Stress and Worries about Money  
- Mark Waldman - Unshackle the Chains of Your Past: letting go of past failures, traumas or events that are keeping you stuck  
- Dr. Srini Pillay - Harvard Professor and past Brain-A-Thon guest 

Reserve your place for this incredible free live video web cast, on Saturday, November 7th @ 1pm - 9pm EST: 

Signup at http://www.nypt.info/brainathon 

----------------------------------------------------------

Do you ever feel like there's an invisible barrier preventing you from reaching your lifestyle and wealth goals? 


Well, the world's top neuroscientists and brain experts say ... you're right! 

You see, your brain is split into two parts: Your rational logical mind and your implicit emotional brain... and the emotional brain is the larger and far more powerful of the two! 

If your emotional desires, beliefs and values don't align with your rational mind's goals ... the two parts of your mind will constantly be fighting each other and undermining your ability to succeed at anything, especially your lifestyle goals. 

Scientists now know that you will NEVER outperform your own internal hidden limiting self-image. Your current results are nothing more than old neural patterns, beliefs, perceptions and habits that you've accumulated over your life that drives all your thoughts and actions. 

But brain scan studies have PROVEN something really exciting...

You can re-wire and re-train the key areas in your brain that control your conscious thoughts AND subconscious feelings and emotions that influence every decision and action you take. 

This requires applying the right brain-training methodologies and technologies in the right way... so you can replace limiting beliefs, behaviors, and habits that are currently keeping you stuck. 

And that's precisely what 6 of the top neuroscientists and brain experts are teaming up to help you do during a historic virtual event on Saturday, November 7th... 

Join John Assaraf, who you may recognize from the hit movie The Secret, and 6 of the world's top neuroscientists and brain experts who are gathering to teach you how to apply the right brain training methodologies and technologies in the right way... so you can replace limiting beliefs, behaviors, and habits that are currently keeping you stuck. 

Here are the experts and a summary of the topics they’ll cover:

 - Dr. Daniel Amen - Change Your Brain, Change Your Income

- Sharon Pearson - From Suicide to $10 Million a Year

- Dr. David Kruger - How to Change your Money Story 

-Dr. Heidi Hanna - Eliminate Stress and Worries about Money - 

-Mark Waldman - Unshackle the Chains of Your Past: letting go of past failures, traumas or events that are keeping you stuck

- Dr. Srini Pillay - Harvard Professor and past Brain-A-Thon guest 

They'll teach you how to get your brain in coherence with your lifestyle goals...and keep you there! No more yoyo-ing around and starting and stopping your success. 

Reserve your place for this incredible free live video web cast, on Saturday, November 7th @ 1pm: 

http://www.nypt.info/brainathon

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!


When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!

results.description:
Dear Friends,

You may or may not be aware of the completely authentic Hindu temples that are in Flushing, Queens. They are magnificent works of art. They are profound places of worship and centers of spiritual wisdom. They are numerous, and several are very close together -- within one or two blocks of each other.

We will be visiting five temples today. Our first stop will be to have lunch at the largest of all these temples. We'll gather at the Temple Canteen of the Ganesh Temple (otherwise known as the Hindu Temple Society of North America). This beautiful structure looks like it was transported here directly from India.

After lunch, our group will be given a temple tour by temple officials. Then we are on to four other temples, all magnificent, and all very close to each other. We'll basically walk two blocks one way, one block back, a block to the side, and then two more blocks.

This tour was meticulously arranged by Minish, with the assistance of Sanjay, both longtime members of our group. At each stop we will be given tours by officials of each temple. It will be akin to walking the streets of India, at least when we get to each temple on our stop. Huge thanks to Minish and Sanjay for leading this tour of tours, and for their many hours of planning and preparation. We also give extreme thanks to all the temple officials involved. To our lucky attendees: prepare yourselves for an utterly transporting and moving experience.

When we did this same event two years ago, we received more favorable comments than any event we have ever done. People were very moved by this window on to another world -- and a profoundly beautiful and spiritual world at that.

A note about the lunch: As it happens, amazingly, you will not get a better lunch deal, just about anywhere in New York. I suggest you order the masala dosa -- for only $4.50!! This is a better dosa than you will get for $10, $11 or $12 at an Indian restaurant.  A masala dosa perfectly satisfies my taste, but there is also a large selection of dosas (chili dosa, onion dosa, for example) in many different styles and flavors for slightly more than $4.50 ($5.00, $5.50 or $6.00). But if you want my advice, just enjoy your extreme bargain $4.50 masala dosa. There is also a nice sized menu of all types of South Indian vegetarian food as well: idlis, vadas, bisibelebath, soups, rice, etc.  The best bargain, in terms of what you pay here vs. what you pay anywhere else, is the dosas. The food here is 100% vegetarian but not all vegan. There is butter in some dishes. Ask the counter person when you order.


We will begin our day at 1:00pm outside the Ganesh Temple Canteen on Holly Avenue, between Bowne Street and Smart Street. The Temple Canteen is located in the basement. We will meet right in front the Temple Canteen sign, which is in large white letters on the face of the building. (See the photograph below.) I will be holding a "MEETUP" sign.

***TRAIN DIRECTIONS UPDATE***

The 7 Train is NOT running today between Times Square-42nd Street in Manhattan and Queensboro Plaza in Queens. Train service between these stops is being replaced by a free shuttle bus service today. The 7 Train WILL be running in the rest of Queens today, from Queensboro Plaza to Main Street-Flushing. (If you are interested, here is the service advisory that announces this: http://web.mta.info/nyct/service/7Line2015/MakingProgressin2015.htm )

Rather than get on the the shuttle bus, I am suggesting these alternate routes if you were going to take the 7 train from Manhattan to Queens today:

1. Take the E, F, or R Trains to Roosevelt Avenue-Jackson Heights, where you can directly transfer to the 7 train. (The 7 Train stop, at that same station, is called 74th St-Broadway.) Then take the 7 Train to the last stop in Queens - Flushing-Main Street.

- OR -

2. Take the N Train to Queensboro Plaza and Transfer to the 7 Train. Then take the 7 Train to the last stop in Queens - Flushing-Main Street.

THEN TAKE THE Q27 BUS TO THE GANESH TEMPLE. SEE DIRECTIONS RIGHT HERE:

Train and Bus Directions: Take the 7 Train to the last stop on the line: Flushing-Main Street Station. The train will let you out on the corner of Main Street and Roosevelt Ave. Walk half a block down Main Street to the HSBC Bank, on Main Street between Roosevelt Ave. and 39th Ave. This is where you catch the Q27 bus, which goes directly to the temple. The bus first goes down Main St., then makes a left onto Kissena Blvd., and then another left on to Holly Ave. You want to get off at the corner of Holly Street and Smart St.  (When you get on the Q27 bus, you can simply tell the bus driver that you want to go to the Ganesh Temple on the corner of Holly Ave. and Smart St.) The bus trip is about 10 minutes. Instead, you could walk from the train to the temple, it is about one mile. Check Google Maps if you want to walk. (I always take the Q27 bus from the train to the temple, and when I return home I walk back from the temple to the train.)

Driving and parking directions can be found here https://nyganeshtemple.org/directions on the temple website. (Even if you are traveling by train and bus, there is a great map on this page that shows the path of the Q27 bus to the temple.)


We'll meet outside the Temple Canteen on Holly Avenue (bet. Bowne St. and Smart St.) from 1:00pm-1:15pm (see the picture below). Look for the person holding up a "MEETUP" sign. From 1:15 until 2:30pm we'll be downstairs in the canteen, feasting on dosa. If you come late, just go through the doors and down the stairs two levels to the bottom, where you will find a table with a MEETUP sign on it and hoards of smiling people surrounding. After 2:30pm, we will begin our tour of the Ganesh Temple itself. 

One more thing: we will be celebrating Diwali (aka Deepavali). Diwali is a multi-day Festival of Lights, and Saturday, Nov. 7th is the first day of it. ("Main Diwali" is on Wed. Oct. 11th.) From Wikipedia: Diwali (or Deepavali, the "festival of lights") is an ancient Hindu festival celebrated in autumn (northern hemisphere) every year. Diwali is the biggest and the brightest festival in India. The festival spiritually signifies the victory of light over darkness. The festival preparations and rituals typically extend over a five-day period, but the main festival night of Diwali coincides with the darkest, new moon night of the Hindu Lunisolar month Kartika.

After lunch, the tour will begin at 2:30pm, and will start with the Ganesh Temple, and then move on to other temples.

First:


Ganesh Temple
45-57 Bowne Street, Flushing, NY  11355
http://www.nyganeshtemple.org/


Followed by:

BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir
44-38 Bowne Street, Flushing, NY 11355
http://www.baps.org/Global-Network/North-America/NewYork.aspx

Next stop:

Om Sai Mandir
45-11 Smart St, NY  11355
http://www.omsaimandir.org/

Then:

Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
46-16 Robinson St, Flushing, NY  11355
https://www.dwarakamaishirdi.org/

And finally:

Hindu Center
4552 Kissena Blvd, Flushing, NY  11355
http://www.hinducenternyc.org/

We anticipate finishing at 5:00pm. It is OK to leave early if you need to. Even seeing just the Ganesh Temple is amazing.

So, on November 7th, 1pm-5pm set your compass for the Ganesh Temple of Flushing, and join us for this profound, moving and beautiful experience,

David, Minish and Sanjay
results.how_to_find_us: Meet on Holly Avenue outside the Temple Canteen (see photo and directions below) between 1:00pm and 1:15pm.  Some one will be holding a MEETUP sign.
results.name: Celebrate Diwali with a Tour of Five Hindu Temples plus Veg*n Temple Lunch

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
